_header: When I revolve in my remembrance
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, Thoughts on his dead mistress, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 120) — three 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) and 4-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
WHen y revolue in my remembraunceThe bewte shappe and þe swete
                    eyen tayne…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…So se y wel but though hit menden mayThat this world nys but
                    even a thyng in vayne
